favourite.article: We dwell with the King for His work, His burden we willingly bear.

Lord, You are the Victorious One! The Working One, the Powerful One, and the most Glorious One! Wow, all we must do is just to dwell with the King! "The work, it is His and not mine;" Lord remind us that You are the One working out Your marvelous plan and we just need to abide in You; be our source and supply! Make us ones that cooperate with You through You and unto You!

What a wonderful gospel this is: The work is His and not mine; He plans and prepares it for me And fills me with power divine. So duty is changed to delight, And prayer into praise as I sing. Dear Lord Jesus, my king, I dwell with you for Your work, And work in the strength of You!
I dwell with my King for His work, and work in the strength of my King!
We have a most glorious King!!
Praise the Lord, the work it is His and not ours!
We should never think that our King is so great that He doesn't dwell with us below. In fact, He loves in our trials to share. We really do have a most glorious King.
